resp.text:
Hey Ms. Polka, we really appreciate your business. We are the best in the market and offer the best quality screens ,and the cheapest also. You brought your iPhone 7 plus on the 4th of this month and when you brought it back today which is less then 23 days not 40 days. it was completely damaged, screen it wasn't out it was damaged and broken from dropping it too many times. And then we give all the respect and offer you $20 off even it was your fault. That's not nice leaving us a negative review and it's not our fault. If anything we can help you with. name: Brianna Kilow
text: I cracked and destroyed my Apple Watch and called over to this business asking for pricing. I spoke with a guy name Duncan(maybe not his name, not sure) and he gave me a price and told me it would take 5 DAYS for it to be fixed and returned back to me. I dropped my watch off on April 16th almost at closing time. It is April 30th and I still have not received my watch. I’ve called multiple times to check the status and every time they tell me it will be back in a couple of days. I called Monday and I was told he received tracking and that it’ll be here in a couple of days. I sent a friend to the place of business to get a status update and my friend was told that it shipped today ( April 30th) and will be here in a few days. So I called back up there and talked to the same guy and he told me that they received tracking information Monday but it didn’t ship until today (BS). I also made him aware that my last day in the area would be Sunday and I will need my watch before I leave, he says if it’s not here by Sunday we can ship it to you ( which I’m sure will be another week). At this point I asked to speak to the manager, he said he wasn’t in but he would call him to see if they could expedite my watch ( how do you expedite a shipment that has already been shipped) and he would get back in touch with. Oh he also mentioned that the reason why it’s taking so long is because the person they sent the watches to is backed up with orders and his shop has been closed and I said why wasn’t I told this from the beginning, I was told 5 days and he said he didn’t know that information until after my watch shipped. So yea, no watch still and it still isn’t promised to be here before I leave town. Worse experience EVER. OH NOT TO MENTION THIS IS COSTING ME $258.

resp.text: Brianna please accept our apologies on the delays in meeting those original time frames   We have seen a fast increase is Apple Watch Repair’s and working with our partners to insure delays are cut down to a minimum going forward we strive to get every device in and out in the fastest possible time . Communication is key and along with the partners we use are working on a ticketing system that will offer status update along the way we greatly appreciate your business and if there is anything you ever need please don’t hesitate to call or stop in! Stay safe and well

name: Blake Bedsole
text: Took my mother to get a new phone today as she busted her old one (motherboard and all) not really fixable; however, after getting a new phone (through a phone company) and being told the phone she picked has no screen protectors available, I quickly messaged ifixandrepair Walmart location, in hopes they would have something. Within two minutes I received a response with the product I requested and the price. Met with Tyler as I came into the store explaining we were on the search for screen protectors for which he showed us all available options and what they would look like once installed. Needless to say not only did my mom get one but so did I and we are both very pleased. I recommend anyone with phone repairs or just on the look for new accessories or gadgets visit Tyler and his team for prompt and quality service!

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your kind words, Blake. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us — and we agree, Tyler is truly a gem to have on our team! We count ourselves lucky for customers like you. We look forward to working with you again in the future!

name: Kayden Chapel
text:
I was out of town and my phone crashed on me. I went in to get it fixed and they said it would be a week and they would ship it to me. After 35 days and tons of phone calls to the owner my phone could not be located and all of them were caught in multiple lies. If that wasn’t bad enough they stopped answering my calls so I was left without a phone. After a month and a half I finally got my phone back and there were even more problems than when I gave it to them. NEVER TAKE YOUR PHONE HERE. The owner Tyler lied to my face and wouldn’t even give me my phone back when I asked for it 6 hours after I left it. I have never dealt with so many dishonest people at one store. Worst experience of my life. The experience was horrible, and to make it worse I got took for $200 and they refused to refund after not fixing the problems and causing more.

Response 2: I guess the “board repair time frame” covers all the lies told. Also once again another lie. Ifixit denied the charges being refunded and the credit card company had to eat them.

resp.text:
Unfortunately. The board repair time frame was out of our control . As a third party board repair team is the ones we use . While having it at board repair a charge back was placed on the payment and was sent back to you as soon as we had it back in our position . This was also handled at the end of last year as we have the charge back notice  as it was never our desire for the time frame we updated you based on the information provided by the boated repair team

Some iPhone 7 devices have many many  board level and chip level flaws that are design issues and also beyond anything that can be controlled or prevented

text: Great place to get all types of games. Very friendly. Great deals. Highly recommend. Me and my wife messed up our purchase at the flea market but we were able to go visit the store and make things right. Definitely much appreciated.

text: Owner was awesome! Super personable and a joy to talk too. Owner was super knowledgeable and made our visit memorable.

name: Brian Taylor
text: Game-N-Trade is hands down my favorite video game shop. I drive from Daphne to visit his shop near the University of South AL and his booth at the Flea Market in Mobile. I do this because Scott, the proprietor, is not only knowledgeable but also genuinely friendly and accommodating! I have been a customer of his for many years and have purchased an Xbox 360, Xbox 1, Nintendo 64, Wii, and, more recently, the hard to find Nintendo Switch. Besides selling consoles dating back to the ’80s (Nintendo, Sega, Etc.) Scott has a vast selection of games and accessories for all the consoles. Plus, he has repaired my phone screen more times than I can count. Scott provides returning customers with great discounts and bundle deals. He has also offered me store credit or trades that I’m comfortable with; Unlike the unsatisfying offers, other establishments offer that will leave one feeling remorseful. Game-N-Trade also has a selection of comics and figurines, but I don’t know much about those. So, cheers to Scott and Game-N-Trade for making my family and me delighted customers. I’m confident once you visit his unique establishment and see the quality merchandise at exceptional prices, you’ll understand why he has so many satisfied, returning customers. I’ve seen the smiling faces when they enter and depart Game-N-Trade!

name: Emphias Ramillion (Emphias)

text: Just had a great experience - The other cellphone shop was going to charge me $30 just to diagnosis my phone so I went in with my phone to here instead. My phone was completely unusable but wanted to see if fixing the screen would help me be able to unlock it because my phone wasnt backed up- The owner fixed my screen but saw that my phone was wiped so there was no point in me trying to fix it since I just wanted the data. He charged me nothing even though he did a ton of work just to help me diagnosis it. Really fast and helpful service 100% recommend this place

name: Mike
text: My iPhone SE lost it's ability to charge with an apple lightning cable. I dropped off the phone and two hours later, the technician diagnosed the issue as a bad lightning port and ordered a new one. I returned the next day to learn a bad logic board was instead at fault. I decided not to fix it since the phone could still charge with an aftermarket cable.  After this process, he billed only for the aftermarket cable.

name: Jacob Brown
text: Amazing, fixed my phone in a couple hours. 10/10 would recommend.

text: I took in my iPhone 11 that I was sure was beyond repair, and I walked out less than 30 minutes later with a display that’s clearer than ever. Friendly customer service and better than expected pricing.

name: unsolicited confidence
text: My experience was great! My dell inspiron computer was not turning on, so i tried to fix it with the help of the dell help forum. The instructions didn’t help me much so i went to the phone clinic. He fixed my computer in like 5 minutes and didn’t charge for it since it was such a small repair. Very fast very effective

name: Kassiday J
text: I Spent over $130+ getting my screen fixed and purchased an otter box. After one drop my screen is shattered flashing different colors, pretty much ruined. I called to be informed there’s no warranty and it’s nothing he can do regards to the otter box not working. So please keep in mind before going here that you’re paying a lot of money for no warranty. I had to go elsewhere and pay more and was informed the screen I got originally from this place was poor quality.

resp.text:
Hey Kassiday.

I am the manager, and i told to our technician.

He will fix it for $49, which does not even cover part price.

Physical damage is very hard to control. We see customers drop and break their 5 times a month.

We also have many customers  visit us after 2 years to repair another device.

We understand your frustration but just wanted to remind that even Apple does not cover pysical damages.

text:
The Phone Clinic should be your #1 stop if you've damaged your phone from a drop. After a drop that ruined my iPhone X's screen, he was able to replace the screen for far less than Apple.

Timely (repaired in 20 mins!), efficient, and has a 'If it isn't perfect, bring it back and let me try again" policy.

Thank you so much!

name: Magic
text: Late last night my cat knocked my iPhone off a counter and shattered it. I went to this Phone Clinic the next afternoon and the man was very nice. Had it fixed within 30 minutes! I just went to Little Italy and grabbed some pizza, by the time I came back to wait for my phone it was already fixed! Looks great and he even put on a screen protector for free. Very nice, fast service. It cost $108 for me, not too bad. I’ve paid more for less quality work and he had an option for a lower quality screen (just the outer part, not the screen itself) for about $10-15 less, but I went with the premium. Great service! (It was an iPhone 7, other ones might cost something different).

name: Clayton Bennett
text: He did a fantastic job, fixed my phone in under 20 minutes while I watched. No gimmicks. Dude was super nice. 10/10 would recommend if you are willing to pay $86 for a cracked phone. He threw in a free tempered glass protector as well 🐐.

name: Alexia Kuenzel
text: Took IPhone XR with no screen and was fixed properly within an hour. Phone screen was previously repaired at IFix and took a week to receive fixed phone. Two days later the screen popped off. For anyone needing a quick repair take your phone here! Best place to get any phone repaired at a great price! Highly recommend everyone to take your phone here to get any problems resolved!

name: Tyler Robins
text: Amazing customer service. I had my iPhone X screen replaced with a refurbished screen, but it had some issues initially. The first replacement had scratches under the glass which I didn’t notice until later. He replaced it for free since it was damaged. The second replacement I got worked for the majority of the time but randomly would get ghost touches, click instead of scrolling, and held down keys. It took me a little over a month to be sure it was a problem with the screen and not iOS glitching. Even though I wasn’t able to replicate the problem, he took my word for it and gave me another replacement! Just an outstanding warranty and customer service. Also, he replaced each screen in less than an hour. Not many places will do same day screen repairs like that at a price lower than Apple’s. Can not recommend enough.

name: Drews
text:
DO NOT TRUST THEM FOR BATTERY REPLACEMENTS ON IPHONES.

About a month ago, I got a battery replacement from them on my iphone, and the new one they put in was running out of battery even more than the old one--about 1% per minute--dying at 24%. So, I ran a battery testing app on it, and the replacement they installed performed WORSE than the original battery that was being replaced (the original was over 2 years old!)

So I brought it back to tell the owner, and he had the nerve to put a second garbage battery in my phone. Luckily, I looked at the battery as he was putting it in, and I saw that this "NEW" battery had the serial number literally covered up, with a black marker. I asked him why it was like that, and he stuttered and basically said nothing.

I got my money back and ordered a do-it-yourself kit from amazon, and what do ya know, the battery works great and performs really well on my testing app. These guys are scam artists and they get away with it because most people would never think to act that way.

Be very careful here, or go somewhere else.

resp.text:
Dear Zachary. Sorry for bad experience. We searched in our database we could not find any records.

Could you pls contact us at 205 887 5151

We will be happy to assist you and provide you with new Oem battery. We have warranty with every item we sell. We can contact our vendor to see what is the problem.

Note that sometimes motherboard drains battery dues to shorted caps or diodes.

We will be glad to do free diagnostic.

Please make sure this is the right location, we are located at

111 east magnolia avenue auburn al

Do you have any proof that it was not OEM?
We use OEM retina displays. Claim with no proof is just guess. Most probably your frame was very bent.  The main problem with iPhone 6 is that frames will bent easily after dropping it for the first time.
We do our best to fix your metal frame as much as we can but keep in mind that we are not body shop.

name: Frank & Shamona parler
text:
Ripping teenagers off!
My 15 year old daughter decided to get her screen fixed on her own with her own money. She only had $80.00. The vape shop charged her $59.99 to repair her screen and it only took 30 minuets. He repaired her screen, but when she attempted to make a call. Her speaker or camera wasn’t working. My son went back up there to only receive the message that it would cost another $49.99 to repair. I called up there and asked him why would he take her money and not correctly fix her phone causing more problems than before. The man went on stating he didn’t break her speaker but the person prior to him who fixed her phone damaged her speaker and camera. Now prior to him fixing my daughters phone, my son fixed her screen 8months ago and everything worked fine. I relayed this information to him in hopes of him reopening her phone to find the problem. He again stated, he will not. It will cost another $49.99. I asked for the manager. He replied he’s the owner. I said so your not gonna do anything about not fixing my daughters phone correctly. He said no. Unless you pay $49.99, there’s nothing else I can do. I said sir, do you know you just crushed a 15 year old lil girls heart who tried to do the right thing on her own? As to what I thought, he gave No reply. I will never enter this store again!

resp.text: Dear customer, your daughter came with a broken screen and said she wants to fix, and that is what we did. We replaced her screen with a brand new screen. Like you mentioned and like we told you, someone already tried to fix the phone before and they cut off the camera wire. Therefore, its not working. The camera replacement is different from the screen replacement. Thank you.

name: Theromiles Flowers
text:
I purchased a replacement battery for my Samsung Tab 3 tablet. I received a call on last week that it was in. Had it installed today, July 9, received a call from store that new battery was not fully charged on installation, allowed them to charge the battery for a few hours to see if fully operating, & picked up tablet but battery was not fully charged (37%). Asked about it and they told me that I was have to fully charge it myself.

I would have thought, if I purchased a new battery it would have been fully charged. If I refused this battery and they ordered another battery, it would take another week before it comes in.

This is not good business and this doesn’t seat well with me. They didn’t offered a discount for my inconvenience on a non-fully charged battery.

name: Chris Murray
text: My experience overall was great interacting with the staff there as they were very helpful and friendly. I went in to get a new antenna on my iPhone. After some quick troubleshooting they said they would be able to fix it.  I returned a couple hours later and the signal was a strong 3G, but by the time I got home  I had no tower coverage at all and it was back to the way it was before. Fortunately they do warranty the work they do for six months. I guess I’ll just have to go back in the morning  and see if anything can be done about it.

name: Mayle Underwood
text: Awesome service!!!  I was able to get off work, make an appointment online for that evening, bring my iPhone 8P with a cracked screen in and drop it off, and then pick it up all new and working in an hour!  Customer service was excellent and the price was affordable.  I left a happy camper!  Thank you Guys

name: Patty Davis
text: Made an appt for an IPhone repair. It was promptly taken in, repaired excellently, and ready to go before promised time. Price was $50 lower than other places I checked. Plus a coupon they offered took an additional $10 off! This was 2 weeks ago and so far the phone looks and functions like new -- very happy! I highly recommend this business!

text: People at the store were great. Fixed my battery in 20 minutes. Apple store told me it would take an hour and ten minutes. So far battery is operating fine. I recommend the Huntsville location.

text:
The repair went well. They finished in an hour as scheduled and were very professional.

This is a great alternate opinion for cellphone repair; and the prices are reasonable. Apple store quoted me $320 for my required repair. I got it done here for $130.

text: Service was prompt and on time. The phone appears to working perfectly. My only complaint is that the protector on the back of the phone came back with many bubbles and dirt trapped under it. This is not a huge deal in that I think I can buy and install a new one, just a little disappointing.

resp.text: Allen, We appreciate your feedback. Our store manager, Zach, will be reaching out to you directly in regards to your concerns. Thanks for your patience.

name: Delinda Cobb
text: My husband & I both have had the batteries replaced in our phones at the South Parkway store & have been very happy with the end result both times.

name: Vera Linville
text: My son had a shattered phone screen. The staff was very helpful. They told us approximately how long the repair should take. When we returned, it was ready and waiting for us.

name: Ashley Davis
text: My experience was very inconvenient and I was dissatisfied. I dropped the phone off for repair and when I returned to pick it up the screen was not replaced properly. So, they offered to fix it and I went back to work. Returning hours later thinking the phone was repaired, I thought I may want to do a test call to someone to ensure everything was working. It wasn’t. They damaged my earpiece while replacing my screen. My phone screen is very dim now and i can get the phone to charge more than 19%. I will be contacting the corporate headquarters regarding my experience at this location.

name: Lynn Hultman
text:
I first contacted Batteries Plus because my iphone wouldn’t hold a charge.  I suspected I needed to replace it.  The representive told me they had the battery in stock and could probably replace it while I waited.  I had already had a conversation with the local Apple Store and they were not helpful at all.  So I took my phone to Batteries Plus.

The store staff were all very friendly and quite helpful.  My battery was replaced while I waited.  I also thought I had a cracked screen, but the tech told me it the screen protector that was cracked, not the screen. Rather than trying to sell me something, he told me it wasn’t that bad and should be okay.  I decided to replace it anyway, and he assisted me in finding the right product and installed it for me.

While I was waiting, I looked over the products, and saw many that would fit some future needs.   We are relatively new to Huntsville, and I’m so glad  I found this store.  I will definitely shop here again.

Without exception, all the store staff was courteous, very helpful, and professional. I really appreciated that they listened to me and solved my problem.  I never felt rushed, nor did I feel any sales pressure.  I chose the products and service.  What a refreshing experience!

name: Danielle Sinopoli
text: Really straight forward and easy process, was given a $10 off coupon for setting appt up online. They knocked out 2 phones for me in an hour and were pretty busy in the meantime. Would recommend them to anyone.

name: Brad Champion
text: I had to have the screen replaced twice. When I picked up the phone after the first replacement I noticed scratches in the glass and air bubbles underneath the glass. I mentioned it when they handed me the phone. They asked me to bring it back the next day and they would fix it. They did and the second replacement was flawless. Back to looking new.

name: Chris Ethridge
text: Had batteries plus replace the charging port on my I phone because it would not connect to my charger.  Picked up my phone after the repair and am able to charge it fine but now no sound out of the speaker and no service.  Returned to batteries plus to have it looked at and was told by the technician that they replaced the charging port again because the one they previously installed had a small tear in the ribbon cable.  I was informed that this ribbon cable tear is why the speaker and antenna were not working.  When I leave the store for the 2nd time the speaker is now working and I have several bars of service so I assume problem solved.  Over the next day I drop virtually every phone call and service is sporadic going from no service to 4 bars back to 1 bar ever few minutes.  I return to batteries plus and they take my phone back and look at it for 30 min or so and tell me there is nothing they can do to fix it.  I tell them that this problem occurred due to the repair work they performed.  The technician tells me that they could not verify the phone was working 100% prior to them working on it so there is nothing they can do to help.  They suggested I do a software update...I do it and after the update my antenna is still messed up.  I understand they couldn’t test it because it was dead and it wouldn’t take a charge.  I also understand there are unhonest people out there that would take advantage of a repair shop but that is not the case here.  I had a fully functional phone that has never given me any problems just a bad charging port.  My recommendation would be to steer clear of repairing your phone and just trash it for a new one if anything goes wrong with it.  In my case the guys at batteries plus didn’t stand behind their work and cost me $100 and lost me as a customer.  The least they could do is offer a refund since they left me with a non funtioning phone.

name: keith hopkin
text: Great experience with knowledgeable personnel that took care of my battery in my cell phone in about 10-15 minutes

name: Adrian Collins
text: I didn’t like my experience. My phone was still not functional after replacing my battery . I had to get a whole new phone. The employees were very nice and helpful but I just feel like I wasted my money .

text: I paid for a battery replacement in my Samsung Galaxy S7. I left my phone overnight and scheduled pick-up for 9 am the next morning. The battery was not charged (0%) so I could not confirm that all systems were working. I left it on their charger and returned at 11:30 and it was only at 40%. That's not what I would call a good battery. And...40 % depleted before 1:30 pm and I had to charge it again. The other problem was a new defect/blemish on the phone's Home button that wasn't there when dropped off for repair. VERY DISAPPOINTED

resp.text: Vickie, We apologize for this experience. Our store manager, Larry, welcomes an opportunity to speak directly regarding your concerns. Please call 256-270-9700 . Thank you for your patience.

name: Johnathon Carrier
text:
I took my phone in last week to get repaired. By that evening my phone screen went completely black ,and didn't turn back on. I returned the next day to explain that I was just there 24 hours before and my phone didn't work. He verified the purchase and fixed it again. The graphics aren't the same. It has been 7 days and my phone keyboard types on its own and continues to shift between apps, makes calls, and taps on things without me touching it. I will not be returning to this location
Very bad service 😢

name: Caitlin Elliott
text: So, walked in and was promptly greeted. Explained that I needed my screen replaced on my iPhone. I take it out to show the guy and he presses all over it, and while he is telling me my battery is swollen and causing the screen to bend, he turns it on and my screen was split in half! I couldn't use half my screen! I work 2 blocks away and have been very careful with my phone (have had a bent-ish screen for months!) so I really don't think this happened in my pocket. I called him out on it as soon as I saw the screen and he said "Look, you can't even use the screen now". He proceeded to talk about other things with my phone and didn't address the problem of him breaking my screen. He priced a screen and battery for me, but I declined and walked out because he broke my screen and absolutely refused to acknowledge it. I went back to the office, called this place and asked to speak to the manager. He asked what was wrong and I told him about the staff breaking my screen. He reveals that the guy I'm speaking with on the phone is the one who "helped" me in the store, and said that he is the manager and owned the store. I calmly explained to him what he did and how I watched him do it right in front of my face. He REFUSED to take responsibility and tried offering a $10 discount for both screen and battery instead. I said no thanks, and to have a nice day before hanging up. I am SO upset - I ended up just buying a new phone since it was about the same cost of what he would charge for a screen and battery. Find someone honest and who knows what they are doing to fix your cell phone - not here!

name: Ty Hampton
text: DO NOT COME HERE!!! They put a CHEAP screen on your phone and do it poorly. I came in and they put a LCD on my iPhone X even though it's supposed to use an OLED. Then the screen keeps scrolling on its own. They tell me to bring it in, so I do. I can't replicate the problem (because I'm not a glitch genie? What do they want?) and so they won't fix it without seeing the problem. WASTE OF MONEY AND POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!! You'd be better off taking a hammer to your phone.

text: I have to say the iPhone clinic here on 15th st in Tuscaloosa has to be hands down the best place to take any iPhone or apple product & the service is quick and over the top , I won’t go anywhere else .

name: Candice P. Brownlee
text: I took my iPhone in today to have my cracked screen repaired (at the 15th Street location). The nice man that helped me told me the cost upfront ($130 + tax) and told me it would take about 30 minutes to repair. To me, this was acceptable, fair pricing and excellent timing. Imagine my surprise when he came back 10 minutes later and told me it would only be $10 and my phone was fixed!!! I couldn’t believe it! He informed me that my actual screen wasn’t cracked but that my screen protector sheet was just in bad shape. (It legit LOOKED like it had seeeeveral cracks and several shattered, busted  corners.) I say that to say this... I would’ve never known the difference! He could’ve came back to the counter and still charged me the $130 and I would’ve never known the difference & would have HAPPILY paid it. The Phone Clinic Tuscaloosa COULD HAVE taken advantage of me and again, I would have NEVER KNOWN. I think this SPEAKS VOLUMES of the integrity & honesty of Phone Clinic Tuscaloosa!!! I caught a $120 break today which was much appreciated! I would do business here 100x’s again—even *IF* I ever do have a legit busted screen. My boss recommended me to Phone Clinic Tuscaloosa and I will HIGHLY RECOMMEND them to everyone I know as well! Good people you can TRUST!!! Thank you for the 5-star service today, Phone Clinic Tuscaloosa! I appreciate you more than you know! :-)

name: Julia Ruderman
text: This happened last February, but I just got around to writing a review now. I broke the LCD screen of my Samsung Galaxy 6 and brought it in to be repaired. They asked for my phone number (I clarified that they wanted the number of the phone I was leaving with them), and told me to come back in a few hours. A few hours later, I come back and they haven't done anything yet. They said they'd have to replace the frame of my phone (because it would break when they removed it) as well but they didn't have a matching gold one in stock and needed my permission to use a white frame instead. The guy said "we called you but couldn't get in touch"...well yeah, you called the phone in your hand. So whatever, I come back a few hours later and it's still not done and I have to wait another half hour. I finally get it back and the frame is extended a few millimeters from the front of my phone- hard to describe but made it more difficult to press the home button and felt very fragile. A few months later, the frame is starting to peel off and I hear a crackling noise every time I press the screen. I took it to a different phone repair place back home, where I was told the first repair was incredibly sloppy. The guy there told me the first repair hadn't even glued the frame back on and it was a miracle it hadn't fallen off yet. For less than $50 (and in under an hour), he glued it on correctly and my phone looks new (aside from the mismatched front). I'm giving 2 stars because I understand things like the mismatched frame isn't their fault, and I knew it was going to be pricey, but overall it was not a good experience at all.

resp.text: Please contact us and let us know how we can improve. Phoneclinictuscaloosa@gmail.com

I had them replace my iPhone 6S Plus LED screen and glass panel for $120. Noticed three nights later that I could see light coming from around the top corner of my phone (like it wasn't closed completely after the repair), so I gently pushed that portion of the panel down so my iPhone wasn't left open and exposed. That cracked the glass screen across the top of my phone and they want another $70 to replace the screen again! Even though it's only cracked because it wasn't reassembled correctly after the initial repair!

I will absolutely be finding another company to repair my iPhone. That is some extremely poor customer service. I'm extremely disappointed...

resp.text:
Hey Tyler sorry to hear that. But in electronic world you will be given "Limited warranty" which will not cover physical damages. When you have any complains you need to bring it before you crack.

We ate not production facility, we buys this parts from our suppliers, which give us limited warranty as well.

In this incidences we offer cost price policy to our customers.

However I am ready to help you more if you can call or txt at 205 887 5151

resp.text:
Luckily there is something called surveillance camera with advanced sound system.

This person clearly states that he is ready to take the risk and accepts the statement read told to him orally by our technician.

There is nothing written that is correct but we are experienced enough to know that in certain phones like "Chinese Huawei" brand there are some complications due to design of the phone:

As another example Samsung galaxy S5 has all the main screws underneath the screen. To do any internal work one needs to remove the screen, which is risky. We always mention this.

It is not fair to blame others afterwards.

This person takes the phone to our fellow repair shop and they fixed it  for him for 240$ just the screen. Cause part is very costly.

name: Nakia Lee
text: I went in with a working phone just battery was dying fast. Got there around 10 am paid for a new battery waited a few hours like I was told returned with the same issue. They took my phone to the back came back said they over heated it and it no longer works. I had a iPhone 6. They refused to replace my phone. I called the cops and still nothing was done. DO NOT TAKE YOUR Phone TO THEM EVER!!!!

resp.text:
Hey Nakia. As far as I learned from the technician your Motherboard was heating and draining battery. There was a short circuit or some burned diode. Initially we could not notice it and per your request changed the battery.

Then the second time you came back we let you to touch your motherboard by your own hands, We have the video record of it. which you could not touch even for a second. It was burning almost

So lets make it clear it is not we heated your board. It was your board was overheating. We told you it can burn PMU (Power management ic chip) if keep trying it. You said go ahead and work on it.

We offered you refund back on battery we installed but you tried different ways to get over and ask for a brand new phone.

First of all if you come to us its because your phone does not work well. It is 3 years old phone with heating board.

we just took our battery of it and refunded you 45$

Sorry but we can not buy you a brand new iPhone 7 to make you happy.

Note: you sat in the store 8 hours in front desk and gave all the customers entering store bad reputation. This is not ethical at all.

text: Liars,I dropped off my Samsung with them paid 100.00 to fix it .they said it would be ready in two to three days so after not hearing from them I called ,said part hadn't arrived will be ready in 3 days .again no response so I went there 7 days 8 days from the initial drop off.I was told part would be in in 5 days so I came back.part hasn't arrived I'm told by a Arab fellow behind the counter after a heavy set white fellow said he would have to check and see what was wrong, and seemEd to give me a weird vibe in his way of acting .then Arab guy says your part is in Oregon should be here in 5 days and said so what do you want to do ? I say just give me my phone and a refund I'll take it elsewhere. I had already spent money on another phone that I brought home and doesn't work but I wasn't going to say anything about it.so then he says we can't do that ! I asked why and his answer was store policy ! It's my phone I own it ,it's my money ,I have had no service plus at the time it was 13 days far from the original 2 or 3 I was told .then he couldn't find my phone so I waited approximately 30 mins and the white guy comes out and says and you could see he was stalling.and said so what are you going to do?I said I'm waiting on my phone and my money.the Arab guy comes back hollering at the back find that phone .said I wasn't listening and I wasn't getting anything and proceeds to pull a sticker off my phone.I said I want my phone my money and leave that sticker on it .he said he didn't have to.took the sticker off and my phone to the back.at this point I was outraged,grabbed his moniter layer it over a said give me my damn phone and he called the police,police said it was a litagation issue when I talked to them and the thievery was not a 911 police matter .also if you look at the mama's of the 5 stars on this page you will find common ground in 85% of the names ! Today is day 19 one extra day from the last time I spoke with the liars at the phone clinic, I'll be returning to check in on things today with a real phone tech.and offer them one last chance to let them make it right,today ! The business is out of my way and would have never even went there had I not called ahead of time and was told the normal wait was a hour  ! I expect some kind of lie as a reply on here and I also feel I've been robbed by this business at this point ! BEWARE!

Te reparan el celular el mismo día (toma alrededor de 3 horas), pero primero hay que ir a realizar un diagnóstico previo, para esto hay que ir al laboratorio, dejar un anticipo para que realizen el pedido del accesorio o pieza dañada y esperar por el tiempo de entrega la cual se te indica el día del diagnostico (todo ese tiempo mantienes el equipo contigo). text:
Brought my first phone in here. He repaired it in about 10 minutes. Asked him about the cases he was selling; giving him all opportunity to do some up selling. He said the nature of the damage would not have been affected with any case. Impressive. Seems upstanding establishment.

Son threw a friend in a pool and so we brought a second phone in. He said issues showed phone screen needed replacement and likely battery as well. After leaving phone with tech, he said replaced screen was in good shape, and that he didn't think i should pay for battery replacement. Wrote me a script for battery replacement at cost should we have any issues. Again, a wide opportunity to charge much more, yet he opted to be far more than fair.

I'll never take another phone anywhere other than Ming's. The level of service is simply insane.

Disclosure - I know nothing about "Ming".

text: Wonderful service & very nice. I was so excited about my phone finally getting fixed. It looked great when he got done. The only thing is when I made a call, I could hardly hear my call. And the volume was all the way up. I've never had any problems with my speaker until after my screen had gotten fixed. Calling tomorrow to see what can be done. I am still pleased with everything else. I highly recommend them & will be back with future phone issues.

resp.text:
Hey Alexis,

I'm very sorry that there is a problem with your repair. We feel that anything less than a 5 star rating means that we did not do our job to your 100% satisfaction.

Based on what you wrote about the ear speaker, it's possible that the plastic film is still left on the screen or a small plastic film on the ear speaker mesh is still on. Those are installed during manufacturing to prevent scratches and has to be removed for full functionality. Please check and make sure there isn't anything blocking the ear speaker itself, if so please remove it. If that is not the problem, please bring it by and we will take care of the problem for you. Don't worry, we will do everything in our power to make sure you are 100% satisfied with your visit.

Thank you very much,
Ming

Working with Apple to find a solution and hopefully pin point who did. Other than that, ummm I like my screen protector.

resp.text: I'm very sorry for the late response we we don't check this at all. But we have never seen or heard of an iPhone getting hacked before. It's possible that you got a safari malware, which can be fixed by doing a clear history on your browser. We do not change customers ringtone during repair unless we have to check the speaker, in which we usually go to the ringtone in settings and play ringtone to avoid going through customers private files. Please let us know if there's anything we can do to resolve this issue and for you to change your rating of us. Thank you very much.

resp.text: Shermekka, for small part repairs we always OEM parts for repairs. We do so because alot of aftermarket small parts are poorly built, and have a high defective rate. OEM small parts are identical in almost every way of the original part that was previously in your device. To leave us a 1 star review because of a claim of another shop is really not right and we truly do not deserve this. As a small business, 1 star reviews have a really negative impact on us, we ask of you, please reconsider your review.

name: Christina Wilson
text: They do a great job, but they're really expensive.

resp.text:
Hey Christina,
Thank you for your feedback, we’re happy to hear that you’re happy with our work. Unfortunately, parts are quite expensive for some phones, which cause repair prices to go up. Our labor rate is usually around $45-75 on top of what the parts cost us, depending on the complexity of the repair. Another reason for higher parts cost is that we use the highest quality parts available to us for your repairs, so you would be satisfied with all aspects of your repair.

Thank you for your feedback, we will definitely keep your review in mind.

name: Bailey Booth
text: STAY AWAY! i had my screen replaced LG V20, the very day i brought it home it wouldnt fast charge anymore.....now it barely charges at all......takes 8 hours to charge. Was not doing this before i took it there

resp.text:
Hey Bailey I have tried contacting you but have not heard anything back,

I’m very sorry to hear that you are very unsatisfied with your repair. When you called a month ago, I explained to you that the charging port that controls the charging portion of the phone is part of the motherboard and not something that can be damaged during screen repair as we transfer over the whole motherboard. If it was damaged, it would not have been able to charge at all. I recommended trying a different charger to see if it was a charger issue and if not, bring it by and we would help take a look at it for you. When I didn’t hear back from you, I assumed the problem was resolved.

Charging issues like that are usually caused by charger going bad, broken solder joint on the charging port (caused by accidental bend of charger while plugged in), or sometimes if the battery is going out. So I think it is very unfair to us to give us such a bad review without giving us a chance to look at it and try to resolve the issue with you. Being a small local business, reviews like that can hurt us in a big way.

So if you can please give us a chance to properly diagnose your phone and resolve this issue, I would really really appreciate it. If you have any questions, you can reach me at our Store phone number (251)665-9888 during business hour.

name: Jason Willis
text:
Called about getting my phone fixed,Said they could do it no problem for $80.00. Drove 45 miles to their store was told it'd be $300.00 just for parts.  Found another place that fixed it for $85.00 in 45 minutes. I hate being lied to to get business.
Edit for reply:
My wife called Tuesday 1/5/21 and told whoever answered the phone, after telling them my issue (power button on my Samsung Galaxy S10 plus fell off). She was told that it wouldn't be a problem and no appointment needed that it'd be $79.00. As I mentioned before I live 45 miles away, I had to leave work early to make sure I had ample time to get there and to get service.
Yes, you are correct,  there was not a record or service ticket made because the guy there looked at my phone said that I'd have to leave it and that the parts would be $300.00 because the board would have to be changed out that the button was all one unit. I value my time and money as much as everyone else and I left without your service. Yes, I do feel like the initial phone call was a bait and switch just to get someone in the store. You know that $19.99 oil change costs $500 because you need tires,wipers, injector cleaning and "blinker fluid". It's just strange that my wife was told one thing and I was told another. I called another shop  told them exactly what was wrong, they said same thing. No problem, no appointment needed.  Took phone, they looked at it and the fixed it for the amount quoted.
Funny thing that one shop said one thing and the other one did it.

resp.text:
Jason, I cannot find a repair ticket or record of your name, are you sure you have the right place? If so, I would like to reach out to you to find out what happened, as we do not give bogus pricing to obtain business. Mistakes do happen and if this indeed did happen, I'd love the chance to make it right!

We have a proven track record of being transparent throughout our entire repair process and we pride ourselves on having some of the best pricing in the industry. I especially appreciate this review because it gives me a chance to explain our repair process.

Before I start, i'd like to point out one thing, there is a giant discrepancy between $80.00 and $300.00. The only phone parts that cost this much are some of the Genuine Samsung Display Assemblies. If another shop was able to resolve this for $85.00, it was a small part repair, like a charging port or proxy sensor, for example. (If parts were needed.) My point is, our prices would have been comparable.

When a customer calls in to obtain a price on a particular repair we do our best to go over the details of the problem or issue they are experiencing. If we are confident we know the solution to the issue at hand, we then will give you a price or at least a ballpark figure, so they know what to expect. If we are unsure what the solution is to the issue, we will ask you to bring the device in to be diagnosed, before giving you a price on the repair.

The Process.

1. Once you come into our office, we go over the details of the issue you are experiencing with your device. We will then go over repair solutions or inform you that it will need further diagnostics to obtain the solution to the issue.

2. We then obtain all your contact information and create you a ticket. We may at this time give you a price on the repair. Below are a couple normal situations.

*Lets go over a couple examples, an iPhone 8, the screen is damaged, everything else on the device is working as intended (we verify this,) we give you a price on the display assembly replacement and an ETA for expected completion.

*Now, lets say its a Gaming Computer, it is randomly turning off or blue screening. We will not know what the issue is without diagnosing all the hardware. In this situation, we will inform you that we will need to perform additional diagnostics to know what it will take to repair this device.

3. Once we have obtained the device, we then will start the diagnostics or repair in the order that it came in. We have other repairs in front of new repairs. Your device will go into the queue and will be worked on when its ticket is next. There are two exceptions to this. Most phone screen repairs, if we have the parts on hand (which we do for all iPhones and some Samsungs,) are completed in an hour or less. (Time will vary depending on the particular repair.) The other exception is, we offer a rush service, this service is paid at the time of when you drop off the device. This is paid to have the device worked on immediately, otherwise tickets are worked on in the order they are received.

4. Once the repair or diagnosis is completed, we then will email, text, and/or call you, to go over any final or further details.

5. Pick up your device and pay for the repairs. Once a repair is completed you can come by and pick up your device at your convenience. We also offer payment options, you can pay in person with cash or card, or you can pay your invoice through our online portal.

**One quick notes, due to COVID-19, we are not allowing our customers to wait on repairs in the lobby. They must either drop them off, wait in the their car, or outside of the building.

Jason, thank you for allowing us to go over this process with you and potential customers that may be reading this. Feel free to reach out to me, Clint Silver, owner at ProTek. I would love to know what happened and would love the opportunity to make it right. Thank you and as always, thanks for choosing ProTek!

name: Courtland Byrd
text:
I want to start by saying that after comparing tech repair companies I chose ProTek because of their great reviews. I debated leaving this review because I know how harmful bad reviews can be to a small business. Unfortunately, my experience with ProTek was so disappointing I felt obligated to share.
When replacing my screen ProTek compromised the integrity of my water resistant IPhone XS causing it to be hyper sensitive to moisture. This resulted in my phone being corroded by light water exposure only 3days after the iPhone repair. ProTek then refused to refund me the 200$ for the faulty screen replacement which essentially destroyed my 1000$ phone. Let me be clear that my IPhone had been exposed to water on previous occasions to the screen replacement with no issues. ProTek even assured me that there was no water damage prior to the screen replacement. I had expected to have a better experience with ProTek because I had confidence in their customer reviews. Sadly, I have to say I was dissatisfied with their services. At the very least I hope others will take my experience with ProTek into consideration and proceed with caution in regards to ProTek’s remarkable ineptitude with apple products.

resp.text:
I am very disappointed by this review, i'll explain why. Unfortunately for phones, we are in the warmer months and people like to be on the water and when you're on the water, these type of things will happen. I want to start off by saying that we repair and/or recover data from thousands of water damage devices. When you first brought the iPhone in for a screen replacement it was because you left the iPhone in the rain and it ruined the screen. (We informed the customer that the screen was the only thing damaged by the rain.) We replaced the screen and put a new screen seal on it, (as we do with all repairs.) The phone then came back with standing water inside the device, this amount of water is concurrent with other phones we see that have been submerged into water. The customer asked for a warranty on the screen, unfortunately we cannot warranty water or physical damage. (Simply putting a new screen on this iPhone would not resolve the issue, given the current condition.) In a case like this, with standing water inside the device, we would need to let the water dry (we have tools to speed this process up.) After the water has dried, it will leave corrosion behind, which will need to be cleaned. We would then remove the logic board from the iPhone housing, clean it with our Sonic Cleaner, and then test the device for further component damage. We then would replace the components needed to repair the device. More than likely we could have saved this customers phone, had the customer let us complete the water damage assessment on this device.

Please remember that iPhone's are not water proof, they are water resistant, and each iPhone has its own water resistance rating. We have seen water damage happen in pretty much every way, from being in your pocket and sweating, to being on the bathroom counter while taking a shower, and to drops in the ocean. Each iPhone handles each exposure differently, because in each exposure, the conditions are different. If you are going to be around water, buy a water proof bag, put your phone into the bag and use it from the outside the bag, only to remove it if you need to make a phone call. This will drastically minimize the chance of water damage. I hope this reply has answered any questions as to how we handle water damaged phones here at ProTek. If you have any questions, concerns, or just want some friendly advice, feel free to contact us at your convenience!

name: Matthew Durkovich
text: Top notch company - super fast results!  My M.2 SSD work hard drive crashed, and after my own IT dep't couldn't fix it, I took it in and it was ALL recovered!  Losing data is very stressful, and these guys were very good at explaining everything.  They returned my call promptly, reminded me that they close at 7pm and were not trying to rush me into seeing them the next day, and offered to assess my hard drive w/out charging me.  In about 5 minutes he came back and said it was all there, and then explained the difference between the $150 cost, and the $300 cost.  basically if I wanted 40GB of files in one folder, it was $150.  if I wanted it to look like it did (folder structure) before the crash, it woudl take more time and therefore $300.  Best extra $150 I have ever spent!  They found info from several previous users, which I'm sure my IT dep't will be thrilled with, lol.  They were great to communicate with, no suprises, met all my expectations, and delivered.  I will go back to them ANY time I need something recovered (or break my phone - didn't even know they fixed phones).  Thanks ProTek!

text: These guys replaced cracked screens on my wife's Samsung smartphone and on my 8" tablet.  Both not "the usual" screen replacements.  On the tablet, they tracked down the glass replacement and ordered it from China.  No other local technicians would go through that much trouble.

name: Scott Dickinson
text:
Ever get that sick feeling in your stomach when you've messed something up? That was me. I had taken apart my laptop because of excessive dust on the fan and the put it back together incorrectly. Seeing an ad for a national company in Huntsville that did computer repair I took it there. 3 weeks later and I get a call that says they can't fix it locally and need to send it off, $75 please.

Discouraged, I collect my laptop and buy a new one. But then I realize I need documents that were stored locally on the old laptop. So searching the internet, I find ProTek. I call and they tell me they can recover my  data.

So I bring my old laptop and then they say, hey, can we try and fix it? Sure, I say. One week later, they've fixed my laptop, and it's up and running for less then what I paid for a new laptop!

Fantastic work! So before you take it to a national place, give the local guys at ProTek a chance to fix your laptop! You won't regret it !

Everything was perfect before they got  it. Just a quick update, The same day i posted this Clint called me and was very eager to repair the laptop. text:
My ear speaker was not working. Took it in to the Ifixandrepair at Wiregrass Commons in Dothan, AL for repair. They installed a part I didn’t need and charged me $98.10. NOT FIXED! Took my phone to another cell phone repair shop in the mall. The repairman was very professional and discovered a missing screw and bracket that Ifixandrepair had left out. Not only did he have the correct part, he also had a replacement screw and bracket. My phone was fixed for $32.70.  Bad business Ifixand repair 😡
Update: 1 month later, and the part I did not need stopped working...

resp.text:
Hi Steven,  thank you for bringing this situation to our notice. This is not by any means reflective of the #iFixandRepair standards of service and customer satisfaction.
Please email us at info@ifixandrepair.com or go to https://ifixandrepair.com/contact with your contact info and details about your case.  We would love to make things right if you give us another chance.

name: Kayla Smith
text:
The most unprofessional manager I've ever seen or had to the deal with. She's not only rude to the customers, but she cant keep her nose out of her phone long enough to make eye contact. The numerous times I've been in there along with  my colleagues, I've never actually seen her do a repair let along do actual work. Not to mention repairs she has done she has messed up. What kind of manager doesn't know how to do her job and do it well. I refuse to walk in this store for business and will take my devices else where as long as she's working and if the Tech guy isn't there. She seems very withdrawn from her work, an lacks motivation skills! Also very hard to take someone serious working on my devices with a big piece of metal sticking out of their lip.

Now as for the ACTUAL TECHS, I've had nothing but great customer service, devices done an ready when they are said to be ready. And always courteous and professional. Very helpful when it comes to explaining what's wrong with the devices. For someone who has done several reviews for several stores on their performances and what they can do to fix it to welcome more business, The manager needs to get some Professional act right, this is a Booming business all over the country not many people can handle this kind of work and all it takes is ONE person to make it to be a bad place of business.

resp.text:
Hello Kayla I’m sorry to hear about your bad experience. Your disappointment is our disappointment, Kayla. You deserve to be provided with a completely efficient, professional, value-for-money experience each time you stop by, and we'd like to wholeheartedly apologize for falling short of your expectations. Please either email details to info@ifixandrepair.com or stop in and allow our manager to see if we can help you.
iFixandRepair - Wiregrass Commons Mall (334) 357-6349

name: Travis Porter
text:
Took my iPhone 6 Plus to have the screen replaced due to a very small crack. The associate working said no problem would take about 20 minutes. After 1 1/2 hours later the associate informs me he thinks he shorted out my back light and that my phone would have to be sent off for repair. I am somewhat of an understanding person until he informed me it would take weeks for me to get my phone back. I am a professional in my field of work and 100% rely on my phone to make a living. I was told sorry and that sending it off was the only option for me.. PLEASE BEWARE & DO YOUR HOMEWORK BEFORE GOING TO THESE GUYS FOR WORK. Guess I should have done my homework and read the reviews on facebook first.

Please see above and notice I said nothing about a payment! Today is now Thursday and I am still without a phone! I will also be sure to leave my review with them as well seeing my bad customer service experience has extended to your location as well as your corporate office.

name: Duncan Mills
text:
I’m calling you out IFixandRepair - Wiregrass Commons Mall (NOT the Dothan Walmart Location). In particular, the manager at this location.

I work for a phone carrier in the same mall and I had a customer approach my stand, asking if the “Apple Airpods” you just sold her were really a legit Apple product. From a few feet away, they looked legit, but upon further inspection, they were definitely a counterfeit. I sell plenty of Apple products out of my store on a daily basis and have for 5+ years. I can tell just by the fit/finish, packaging, font, etc that these are definitely not a real Apple product, or even a refurbished unit.

From what your customer told me, you reassured her that they were a legitimate product, and refused to offer her a refund, only store credit until she threatened to get mall management and the police involved.

Shame on you for preying on elderly and unknowing customers trying to get Christmas gifts for their families. She told me she spent the last $90 of her fixed income to get these for her daughter as a late Christmas gift.

You are selling items under false pretenses and not disclosing the authenticity of the products. Makes me wonder how many other people you have ripped off with this same scam. This is some shady business practices and unfortunately it can tarnish the customer’s trust in cellular/mobile vendors and repair companies alike.

Pictured is the “Apple AirPods” you sold her and the last picture is a stock image of the legitimate product from Google from a trusted device review source.

name: Ryan Cunningham (rjcfilms)
text: Had a broken tablet took it to I fix in the mall and they said they would order the part and it would be a same day repair when it came in. A week or so passed and they called and said the part was in. I took my tablet in for repair they said they may not get to it that day because they were busy... understandable. Well I came back late the next day and they said they still haven't got to it and they would leave a note to do it first thing the next day. Well the next afternoon I called and they still didn't have it ready. So a few more days passed and they called and said they had broken the screen and had to order a whole new screen. Told us we had to wait for the tech to get paid because he had to pay for the new replacement parts. It took more than 1 month to get the new parts and for them to finally call us and say it's ready. We get to the store and ask to pick up the tablet and it is in horrible condition the back panel wasn't even put back on properly and had spots where it was raised up enough I could see the internals on the tablet. We refused to take it that time because it was not repaired. We also learned the the money we origanally paid them to fix it was refunded to the tech who had broken the tablet. The employee/tech refused to try to repair the tablet saying "I'm not going to try to press that together and break that tablet." She was referring the the back panel I mentioned was raised up in places. We told her to contact the manager and she pulled out her cell phone called the manager and said "These people are refusing to take the tablet and I'm so mad I'm about to just walk out" the manager told her to tell us she would take a look at it tomorrow. A few days passed they called again and said it was ready so we went to get it and it was better condition but still it is very scuffed up on the trim all the way around the screen and the back is still slightly raised up in a few places. We took it anyway out of pure frustration with the employees and the manager. This place is a joke DO NOT take anything here to be fixed or you will regret it. This is the first time I've ever written a review but this place was so bad I felt like I needed to put it out there that this place is not a professional establishment and they treat their customers like garbage after you hand them your money.

resp.text:
Hello Ryan  I’m sorry to hear about your bad experience. Your disappointment is our disappointment, Ryan. You deserve to be provided with a completely efficient, professional, value-for-money experience each time you stop by, and we'd like to wholeheartedly apologize for falling short of your expectations.
Please either email details to info@ifixandrepair.com or stop in and allow our manager to see if we can help you.

name: Stephen Smith
text: I would strongly recommend against allowing anyone at this location to attempt to repair your property.  I took in my iphone 5s for a cracked screen.  Up front they were very confident stating that it would only take about 45 mins and for a somewhat reasonable price.  The first screen they put on they said was "glitchy".  The second screen had screws that were so over-tightened they pushed through to the glass.  The third screen worked but somewhere along the way several other items were damaged.  When first checking in the phone they did a thorough checklist noting that everything worked properly.  Now I have a phone that doesn't have a vibrate function anymore, the earpiece only works sometimes, and it drops calls all of a sudden now.  They told me that they aren't sure what is wrong and they will order a part and maybe that will work.  I told them I didn't want anyone else trying to work on my phone anymore (3 different people already messed up different parts of the phone).  I asked for a refund and was told that if they got approval from the district manager, they might be able to install a broken screen  on my phone and give me my money back.  Do yourself a favor and read the reviews on Yelp, and the BBB.  This business has shown that they will damage your property and keep your money.

resp.text:
Hello Stephen I’m sorry to hear about your bad experience. Your disappointment is our disappointment, Stephen. You deserve to be provided with a completely efficient, professional, value-for-money experience each time you stop by, and we'd like to wholeheartedly apologize for falling short of your expectations. Please either email details to info@ifixandrepair.com or stop in and allow our manager to see if we can help you.

name: Eric Faulx
text:
***EDIT***

***Ms. Casey had everything fixed for me once this post was made, 4 starring it for everything that happened. Would recommend to friends, and will go back if I ever need quality work.***

They charged me $120+tax to repair my broken screen and BREAK MY HOME SCREEN BUTTON! Two days ago I took my iPod 5 in to get the screen replaced on it. The home button still worked on it prior to me dropping it off. Once I got my iPod Touch back with the screen repaired my home button no longer worked. Casey, the owner, claimed it to be a result of the damage that occurred to it prior and I had come to found out that it actually was a result of her improperly removing the button. She tore the conductive ribbon strip from the home button that lets it depress and click the dome switch underneath. She claimed that it was not her fault did not offer any kind of apology and told me it was unfixable. I have also been told this kind of repair is not fixable by any conventional means and that the iPod might as well be replaced. DO NOT GET YOUR DEVICES "REPAIRED" AT THIS ESTABLISHMENT. Extremely dissatisfied with this business and it's practice -Eric Faulx

resp.text:
Good afternoon Eric,

Sorry to hear that. We are reviewing your case with our DM. In short we will give you a quick answer.

name: Donna Mott
text:
I would not recommend this store to dust off the screen of a phone or tablet much less attempt to repair it.  If I could give less than 1 star, I would.  We took an iPad 3 to iFix on December 20th to have a broken screen replaced.  We called later that evening and went to pick it up after they said it was complete.  We tested the iPad while at the store in front of Tyler, an iFix employee, and the power button wouldn't work, the magnetic closure to put the iPad to sleep wouldn't work, and you couldn't lock/unlock the iPad.  They also scratched the body of the iPad around the edges when they replaced the screen.  Tyler made a note of the issues and agreed we could bring the iPad back for repair after the Christmas holiday.  While we had it, the screen detached from the iPad body.

We took it back to iFix on or about January 9th.  We had to swipe (erase all content) off the iPad for them to repair it, so we had to buy a new one to replace this one in the interim.  We have received NO communication from anyone with iFix since that time unless we've called for a status.  We have called numerous times to speak with the manager, David and Tyler the original employee dealing with us on this.  Each time it's the same story...they're working on it and since that time, David is no longer with them.  I emailed all of the contacts on the Corporate iFix website and never received a response.  The employee we were dealing with, Tyler, can't tell us anything and he said the district manager was now handling our case.

Amber Wells, the District Manager with iFix, and they would not agree to refund the $196.19 we paid for the screen replacement and she said they can't repair it.  I filed a Better Business Bureau complaint in March and iFix never responded to it.  The leasing manager, Rhonda Clark, at Wiregrass Commons Mall has attempted to get this resolved with the owner but has not been successful.  Apparently there are other customers who have complained to the mall management because iFix won't stand behind their work, lack of work, or whatever you wish to call their shoddy attempt at service.

At the very minimum, they should have refunded what I paid for the repair.  Unfortunately now, I have no confidence that the iPad will ever work the same even if someone else replaces the screen.  PLEASE don't make the mistake of taking any devices to this store.

As of September 24, 2014 they STILL have my iPad.  Nearly 9 months later and nothing from them...no attempt at resolution at all.  iFixandrepair has yet to contact me.  Apparently they have no interest in resolving the issue.  I'm taking them to small claims court to try to get this resolved.  Again, I would NOT recommend them for repairs of any sort based on my personal experience and the lack of concern of their staff.

resp.text:
Hello Donna I’m sorry to hear about your bad experience. Your disappointment is our disappointment, Donna. You deserve to be provided with a completely efficient, professional, value-for-money experience each time you stop by, and we'd like to wholeheartedly apologize for falling short of your expectations. Please either email details to info@ifixandrepair.com or stop in and allow our manager to see if we can help you.
iFixandRepair - Wiregrass Commons Mall (334) 357-6349
